data.title: Fixed Linux packages with bundled binaries being labeled as noarch
data.body: Apparently lintian does a check on DEB install not after build which is of course exposing our dirty laundry. http://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/273rm0/openra_playtest_20140602_with_even_more_polish/chy4atp?context=3

data.title: More lua crash fixes
data.body: fixed more places that could possibly be querying dead actors

data.title: Add gates into RA.
data.body: Don't we have graphics for gates? Lets add them in already.

data.title: Fix Chameleon Spy to use cloak instead of disguise
Instead of directly draining materials from silos, drain materials when construction is completed
data.body:
Right now, materials are drained from silos as they are building. This leads to an interesting scenario where you could just build a building and then sell it to free up space in silos without any cost. In the original games, this would prevent you from building any more buildings. However, now we have two types of build queues that mostly negates this disadvantage.

Instead of draining ore silos as buildings and units are built, what if materials are only drained if buildings are built and units are completed? This would make the old method of freeing up silo space useless, and in addition, make silos more useful by raising the spending cap.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2470676-idea-instead-of-directly-draining-materials-from-silos-drain-materials-when-construction-is-completed?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Build ontop of resources? (Ore/Tiberium/Spice)
data.body: Would be nice if you could simple place buildings right on top of resources, destroying the resource. It's just kinda annoying when you want to put a building somewhere and there's a single cell of ore blocking it.

data.title: Mission Intervention - crash
data.body:
Just got this crash some time after I killed "HarvGuard1":

```

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18449
Exception of type `NLua.Exceptions.LuaScriptException`: A .NET exception occured in user-code
Inner Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (apc 696 (not in world))
     bei OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
   bei OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Contains[T](Actor actor)

   bei LuaGeneratedClass1.CallFunction(Actor , AttackInfo )
   bei System.Action`2.Invoke(T1 arg1, T2 arg2)
```

data.body:
should be available for "both" factions

would add a different defense unit against all the soviet infantry like shock-trooper , flamethrower , grenadiers , hijackers ... 

he is on the wrong side anyway , because he has more use as "defending unit" rather then "attacking" ... which makes him more a unit for allies 

also , it gives more option to defend against soviet-rushes like "apc + flame/grenade/hijack" ... a pillbox "always" gets triggered first on the apc , and has to manually adjusted to shoot on the infantry 
and not on the apc with his beefy armor

data.title: Fixed $TRAVIS_TAG being empty on release branches
data.body: According to https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/2373 I have to reg-ex white-list the name of the _tags_ not the release branches under `branches: only:` to trigger a build. Only then `$TRAVIS_TAG` won't be empty. That is counter-intuitive and I could not find that in the documentation. Hope other people find this via the GitHub search.

data.title: Crash on fail auto-download map
data.body:
This is a bug I have been encountering for quite some time.

When I join a server with a map I do not yet have, the game will auto download it. But when it could not reach the remote server (in my case). The download fails in a Try .. Catch block which is nice and returns False.

But down the road the game will try to load the map regardless of a successfully downloaded map (True) and crashes because the key is not found.
![openradebug4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5729926/3141276/32bf63aa-e972-11e3-90cf-3245fcf1474c.png)

Fix should be straightforward.

data.title: Fixed Dune 2000 crashing when placing buildings and using strange locale settings in latest playtest
data.body: Reported at http://www.openra.net/news/playtest-20140525/#comment-1414461912 probably due to locale settings. Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5262.

data.title: Recatorized 3 tiles from Rock-Cliff-Sand to Rock-Cliff-Rock
data.body: Tried to fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4243 but failed. Still this was the left-over changes.

data.title: Adding music other than AUD
data.body:
Hello guys, me again.

Just thought I'd drop in because this is something I have no idea how to do. I'm using a release of OpenRA that doesn't support WAV files in the bits folder. So in adding new music tracks in-game. I need to convert these filed into AUD, which I've done with XCC mixer, but when I listen to the tracks in-game, their pitch is warped to be extremely deep, this is frustrating. I use audacity to convert the files and when listening to them in VLC, they function properly. So I imagine it's something to do with OpenRA.

data.title: Updated preview picture for Dune 2000

data.title: Make Ready text blink red and white
data.body: The current blinking behavior as per #5178 is not optimal since the ready text may not be seen when taking a quick look at the production tab. This pull request makes the text alternate between red and white colors, instead of turning it on and off. This is for both Red Alert and Tiberian Dawn mods.

data.title: Fixes to StreamExts.
data.body:
Separated out from #5503 and built upon.

Fixes #2441, Fixes #4135, Fixes #4357, Fixes #5520, Fixes #5580, maybe others.

Lots of code was using Stream.Read without checking the return result. This is a fatal error as Stream.Read is allowed to return less than the requested data. If you don't check the return result your array will only be partially filled and bad things happen.

ReadBytes was broken and would throw an EndOfStreamException if the count was anything less than the requested number. If the count was non-zero then this is a bogus exception and results in traces like in #5520, #5580.

ReadAllBytes was broken and wouldn't even do you the good graces of throwing an exception. Instead it'd hand you back a partially filled array and let you choke later on all the zeros at the end of the array you weren't expecting. PrepareMap called this method so you would get traces like in #2441, #4135, #4357.

Personally I didn't know file streams did this (I never checked but I assumed this was something more intended for network streams and stuff) but today I learned that they do. This explains why it only occurred occasionally - most of the time you would actually get all the bytes you requested.
